rtega_mnemonic:
杏杏RSapricot, almond
  • RS. tree 木 with fruit 口 on the ground
  • tree 木 with fruit like a round mouth 口
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: A open mouth 口, waiting for fruit to fall from the tree 木
purpleculture_examples:
银杏 [ yín xìng ]: ginkgo (tree with fan-shaped leaves and yellow seeds); maidenhair tree
杏花 [ xìng huā ]: apricot blossoms
杏树 [ xìng shù ]: apricot tree
杏仁 [ xìng rén ]: almond; apricot kernel
杏眼 [ xìng yǎn ]: large, round eyes (considered beautiful)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 口 [ kǒu ] mouth; entrance, gate, opening
heisig_chinese_memo: From the tree straight into the mouth is the best way to eat an APRICOT!
heisig_story: Since apricots can be eaten just as they fall from the trees, picture this mouth agape at the bottom of a tree (just as the elements have it), waiting for apricots to fall into it.
koohiiStory1: From the tree straight into the mouth is the best way to eat an APRICOT!
koohiiStory2: Imagine Totoro sleeping under his tree. As he snores a giant apricot falls nicely into his open mouth and he emits a giant burp of satisfaction. I can hear that music alreay....to - to to - to - ro...
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: What does a tree make that you'd want to put in your mouth? An apricot! Apricots are also about the size of an open mouth, so they kind of look like mouths hanging down under the trees. You can bite them right off the tree with your own mouth!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the mouth sized apricots hanging down off the tree. Imagine using your own mouth to bite them down. Just don't swallow the pit!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: After you put the apricot in your mouth you realize that this tastes really familiar, but not pleasant. It tastes just like the anchovies (あん) from the zoo (ず) smell. How did that happen? You don't like apricots anymore.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine trying to eat the bite sized apricot and spitting it out after the taste of anchovies from the zoo fill you up.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: at the mouth (口) of the tree (木) is an apricot
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: From the tree straight into the mouth is the best way to eat an APRICOT!
humanum_full_description_en:
From " wood " to " mouth ", I suspect that apricot is delicious (He Linyi), the original meaning is apricot fruit. "Shuowen": "Apricot, fruit. From the wood, can save the sound." Gui Fu, "Shuowen Jiezi Yizheng": "The fruit is also, "Gewu Conghua": "Apricot fruit, the taste is more fragrant than plum but sour , The core and the flesh are separated."" According to Xu Shen, " apricot " is a " fruit ", which can be followed. Only to the " may " to " apricot " sound character, like commercially, Middle Chinese word far apart. The oracle bone inscriptions also have the characters " Wood " and " Ding ", which are similar in shape and structure to " Xing ". There is still controversy in the academic circles about how to interpret this character.

" Xing " oracle bone inscriptions are used as names, "Compilation" 17524: "Broom (fu) apricot [show] Santun." That is, a woman named Xing repaired three pairs of bone plates (Liu Xinglong).
humanum_short_description_en: From " wood " to " mouth ", I suspect that apricot is delicious (He Linyi), the original meaning is apricot fruit.
humanum_full_description:
從「木」從「口」，疑會杏實可口之意(何琳儀)，本義是杏果。《說文》：「杏，果也。從木，可省聲。」桂馥《說文解字義證》：「果也者，《格物叢話》：『杏實，味香於梅而酸不及，核與肉自相離。』」按許慎訓「杏」為「果」，可從。唯以「可」為「杏」的聲符，似可商，二字上古音相距較遠。甲骨文另有從「木」從「丁」的字，形構與「杏」相似。對於如何釋讀該字，學界尚有爭議。

　　「杏」甲骨文用作人名，《合集》17524：「帚(婦)杏[示]三屯。」即指名叫杏的婦人整治了三對骨板(劉興隆)。
humanum_short_description: 從「木」從「口」，疑會杏實可口之意(何琳儀)，本義是杏果。

From " wood" to " mouth", I suspect that apricot is delicious (He Linyi), the original meaning is apricot fruit. "Shuowen": "Apricot, fruit. From the wood, can save the sound." Gui Fu, "Shuowen Jiezi Yizheng": "The fruit is also, "Gewu Conghua": "Apricot fruit, the taste is more fragrant than plum but sour , The core and the flesh are separated."" According to Xu Shen, " apricot" is a " fruit", which can be followed. Only to the " may" to " apricot" sound character, like commercially, Middle Chinese word far apart. The oracle bone inscriptions also have the characters " Wood" and " Ding", which are similar in shape and structure to " Xing". There is still controversy in the academic circles about how to interpret this character. " Xing" oracle bone inscriptions are used as names, "Compilation" 17524: "Broom (fu) apricot [show] Santun." That is, a woman named Xing repaired three pairs of bone plates (Liu Xinglong).

杏字的基本解释

杏
xìng
落叶乔木，叶卵形，花白色或淡红色，果实称“杏儿”、“杏子”，酸甜，可食：杏仁儿。杏黄。

杏字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xìng］
［《廣韻》何梗切，上梗，匣。］
(1)木名。落叶乔木。叶宽卵形。花粉红色或白色。核果，圆形，成熟时黄红色，味酸甜，供生食外，可制成杏干、杏脯等食品。
(2)果名。杏子。杏树的果实。
(3)指杏花。
(4)杏仁。参见“杏酪”、“杏粥”。
(5)象杏子或杏花那样颜色的。参见“杏黄”、“杏臉桃腮”。亦指象杏子那样的。参见“杏眼”。
(6)古地名。春秋时周的城邑。
(7)古地名。春秋时齐的城邑。

杏字的英文翻译

◎ 杏
apricot

杏字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　杏； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页511第14
【唐韻】【正韻】何梗切【集韻】【韻會】下梗切，?音荇。【說文】果名。【格物叢話】杏實，味香於梅，而酸不及，核與肉自相離。【盧諶·祭法】夏祀用杏。【管子·地員篇】五沃之土，其木宜杏。【文獻通考】杏多實不蟲，來年秋禾善。　又【周禮·司爟註】夏取棗杏之火。　又【左思·吳都賦·李善註】平仲果，其實如銀。一名銀杏。　又北杏，地名。【春秋·莊十三年】齊侯會於北杏。　又【神仙傳】廬山有杏林，董奉故里。

考證：〔【禮·祭法】夏祠用杏。〕　謹按禮祭法無此語。太平御覽引盧諶祭法曰夏祠用杏。謹將禮字改爲盧諶。祠字改爲祀字。
杏字的源字形

杏字的起名意思

：指杏树，杏花 ，杏仁。

apricot
Basic explanation of words
apricot
xìng
Deciduous tree, oval leaves, white or light red flowers, fruits are called "Apricots" and "Apricots", sweet and sour, edible: almonds. Apricot.
apricot
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xìng］
["Guangyun" He stem cut, upper stem, box. ]
(1) Wooden name. Deciduous trees. The leaves are broadly ovate. The flowers are pink or white. Stone fruit, round, yellowish-red when mature, tastes sweet and sour, and can be made into dried apricots and dried apricots.
(2) Fruit name. Apricots. The fruit of the apricot tree.
(3) Refers to apricot blossoms.
(4) Almonds. See "Apricot Cheese", "Apricot Congee".
(5) Color like apricots or apricot blossoms. See "Apricot Yellow", "Apricot Face Peach Cheeks". Also refers to things like apricots. See "Apricot Eye".
(6) Ancient place names. Cities in the Spring and Autumn Period.
(7) Ancient place names. The city of Qi in the Spring and Autumn Period.

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　杏; Kangxi strokes: 7; Page number: page 511 14
[Tang Yun] [Zheng Yun] He Geng cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Next cut,? Yin Nun. 【Said the text】The name of the fruit. 【Gewu Conghua】Apricot fruit, fragrant in plum, but not sour, core and flesh are separated. [Lu Chen·Sacrificial Method] Xia Si uses apricots. [Guanzi·Diyuan Chapter] Five fertile soil, its wood is suitable for apricots. [Document General Test] Apricots are not worms, but they are good in the autumn of the coming year.　[Zhou Li·Si Yao's Note] Xia takes the fire of jujube and apricot.　[Zuo Si·Wu Du Fu·Li Shan Note】Ping Zhongguo, in fact, is like silver. A ginkgo.　Apricot again, place name. [Chunqiu·Zhuang Thirteenth Year] Qihou will meet in Beixing.　[The Legend of the Immortals] There is apricot forest in Mount Lu, the hometown of Dong Feng. Textual research: [[Ritual·Sacrificial Law] Xia Temple uses apricots. 〕 　 There is no such saying in accordance with the rites and sacrifices. Taiping Yulan cited Lu Chen's sacrifice to the Xia Temple using apricots. I would like to change the word ritual to Lu Chen. The word shrine was changed to the word sacrifice.

Из дерева (как дерево), изо рта (как изо рта) это означает, что абрикос - это такое дерево, плоды которого можно есть.
Первоначальное значение - абрикосовое дерево.

абрикос
********
абрикос
xìng
абрикос
Radicals: 木, 口  (tree, mouth)
Meaning Mnemonic
What does a tree make that you'd want to put in your mouth? An apricot! Apricots are also about the size of an open mouth, so they kind of look like mouths hanging down under the trees. You can bite them right off the tree with your own mouth!
Picture the mouth sized apricots hanging down off the tree. Imagine using your own mouth to bite them down. Just don't swallow the pit!
Reading Mnemonic
After you put the apricot in your mouth you realize that this tastes really familiar, but not pleasant. It tastes just like the anchovies (あん) from the zoo (ず) smell. How did that happen? You don't like apricots anymore.
Imagine trying to eat the bite sized apricot and spitting it out after the taste of anchovies from the zoo fill you up.
